64 bit support is just as good for Ubuntu on a macbook pro as it is for Ubuntu on any other 64 bit PC.
but there are many programs that aren't available for 64-bit machines
There are very few programs available for 32 bit Ubuntu which are not available for 64 bit Ubuntu.
last time, I couldn't even get firefox to work on 64-bit. Has that really changed so much within a year?
In what way did firefox not work?
Mozilla had no official 64-bit Firefox port
Firefox is installed by default in Ubuntu.
but that wasn't all, there were plenty of programs I could get working
And Ubuntu has been shipping 64 bit firefox with 64 bit Ubuntu since the very first release of Ubuntu in 2005.
On a Macbook Pro you'll need to use the +mac iso image to be able to boot from the install CD. Looking for a link to it now.
Correct. Because only the 64 bit iso has EFI support, which causes problems with Apple's firmware. The +mac image has EFI support removed.

http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/ports/releases/10.10/release/ubuntu-10.10-desktop-amd64+mac.iso or if you don't want the Desktop CD use any of the other +mac images from http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/ports/releases/10.10/release/.
